Package Helpers

Class Helpers

java.lang.Object
Helpers.Helpers
public class Helpers extends Object
Utility class containing shared logic for parsing JSON strings and handling HTTP network requests.

  • Method Details

    • parseString

      public static String parseString(String json, String key)
      Extracts a string value from a JSON string for a given key.
      Parameters:
      json - the JSON string to parse
      key - the key to search for
      Returns:
      the string value associated with the key, or null if not found

    • parseInteger

      public static Integer parseInteger(String json, String key)
      Extracts an integer value from a JSON string for a given key.
      Parameters:
      json - the JSON string to parse
      key - the key to search for
      Returns:
      the integer value, or null if invalid or not found

    • parseFloat

      public static Float parseFloat(String json, String key)
      Extracts a float value from a JSON string for a given key.
      Parameters:
      json - the JSON string to parse
      key - the key to search for
      Returns:
      the float value, or null if invalid or not found

    • getPort

      public static int getPort(String json, String service)
      Helper function to return the port for the specific service from the config file
      Parameters:
      json - the config file json data
      service - the serivice name
      Returns:
      the port number (int), if invalid return -1

    • getIP

      public static String getIP(String json, String service)
      Helper function to return the IP for the specific service from the config file
      Parameters:
      json - the config file json data
      service - the serivice name
      Returns:
      the IP number (int), if invalid return -1

    • requestSend

      public static Object[] requestSend(String url, String method, String body) throws IOException
      Sends an HTTP request and returns the status code and response body.
      Parameters:
      url - the destination URL
      method - the HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.)
      body - the request body for POST requests
      Returns:
      an Object array where [0] is the status code (int) and [1] is the response (String)
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the request
